examples: While it's always better to be honest, sometimes a bad excuse is better than none, especially if it can help diffuse a tense situation.
The oxygen diffuses into the blood where it is picked up by red blood cells.
Now you can diffuse.
After about three hours, alcohol from your blood will have diffused throughout the endolymph.
That gas diffuse into the edges of the meat, bind to the myoglobin in place of oxygen.
words.defineVi: lan truyền hoặc khuếch tán qua

examples: So all life on earth relies on diffusion.
Another factor is diffusion of responsibility.
Meanwhile, other small molecules reach the sweat mainly by diffusion through the sweat glands.
Cell membranes allow for diffusion of certain molecules.
Diffusion is the rule of the universe that molecules, especially in liquids or gases, are constantly moving around in all directions.
words.defineEn: the act of dispersing or diffusing something
words.defineVi: hành động phân tán hoặc khuếch tán một cái gì đó

examples: Your argument is now invalid.
So, I'm like, OK, well that's, you know, not a totally invalid argument.
In December 2020, the retailer was sued by the Justice Department, accused of fueling the opioid crisis in America and unlawfully filling thousands of invalid prescriptions.
Link doesn't like coconut, so his opinion is also invalid for these.
and I will render an incredibly unfair and invalid opinion.
words.defineEn: someone who is disabled or frail and cannot care for themselves, often due to a chronic illness or injury
words.defineVi: người tàn tật hoặc ốm yếu và không thể tự chăm sóc bản thân, thường là do bệnh mãn tính hoặc chấn thương

examples: Does that invalidate the whole reason people came out in the first place?
Recently, the Roberts court invalidated parts of the Voting Rights Act, which had been passed originally in 1965 and renewed by Congress in 2010.
None of these studies invalidate the research that has found some games, especially violent ones, can possibly increase stress and aggression in some people.
You ended up with another woman who invalidates you.
YVONNE RAWHOUSER, California: Seeing the fires raised about 2,000 degrees Fahrenheit, the interior wiring of my home has been invalidated.
words.defineVi: làm cho không hợp lệ để sử dụng

words.defineEn: (used especially of glances) directed to one side with or as if with doubt or suspicion or envy
words.defineVi: (được sử dụng đặc biệt với những cái nhìn) hướng về một phía với hoặc như thể có sự nghi ngờ hoặc nghi ngờ hoặc ghen tị

examples: If we measure the amount of time between two equinoxes, it ends up being 21 minutes shorter than a sidereal year.
The amount of time it takes a star or constellation to reach the same point in the sky at the same time of day is 365 days 6 hours 9 minutes 9.76 seconds, or a sidereal year.
That means if we based our calendar on sidereal years, the seasons would quickly get out of sync, Christmas would end up in July, dogs and cats, living together, mass hysteria!
words.defineEn: (of divisions of time) determined by daily motion of the stars
words.defineVi: (của sự phân chia thời gian) được xác định bởi chuyển động hàng ngày của các vì sao

examples: The project manager reminded her team to focus on the project goals and not get sidetracked by minor issues, emphasizing the importance of not losing sight of the forest for the trees.
I think the speaker believed she was telling the room that everybody that was crossing the border was a criminal, and that kind of sidetracked everybody for a while.
words.defineEn: wander from a direct or straight course
words.defineVi: đi lang thang từ một khóa học trực tiếp hoặc thẳng

examples: Your president has little proxies operating all over the globe.
And it's become sort of a proxy for the big cultural dispute.
Most Europeans didn’t rule their African possessions directly but rather through the proxies of local rulers.
One study found that subjects used their own sense of morality as a proxy for that of other people.
It's always done through proxies, through people who the United States or the Soviet Union is acting on the behalf-- or who are acting on behalf of the United States or Soviet Union.
words.defineEn: a person authorized to act for another
words.defineVi: một người được ủy quyền để hành động cho người khác

examples: Proximity alone isn't enough, though.

People within close proximity of the president were tested.
Proximity sensors are used to detect the presence of a nearby object without physical contact.
Proximity sensor, walk away lock, wake on approach.
words.defineEn: the region close around a person or thing
words.defineVi: khu vực gần xung quanh một người hoặc vật

examples: Our ship changed course.
The course gives you a bird's eye view of European art history.
The guidance system keeps the machine on course.
The college runs summer courses for foreign students.
The ship is holding a south-easterly course.

examples: Oh, I already know alias.

examples: The suspect's alibi had more holes than Swiss cheese, and the jury didn't believe a word of it.

Acknowledging that a drowning man will clutch at a straw, the defendant grasped at the flimsy alibi even though it appeared implausible, hoping it might provide some reprieve from the charges against him.
That's a good alibi for anything.
words.defineEn: proof that indicates a person was somewhere other than the place where a crime took place and therefore could not have committed it

examples: Be careful not to alienate your friends as you climb to the top of the company, because if things don't work out, you'll have no one there to break your fall.
As Asmus shows, even the German government remained in two minds as to the benefits of no longer being on the frontline and the drawbacks of alienating Russia.
I alienate everyone.
The Hispanic voter in America has been completely alienated from the Republican Party by a hostile message.
Proms also can alienate those who do not conform to the heteronormative paradigm.
words.defineEn: make withdrawn or isolated or emotionally dissociated

examples: There was the suave hunchback.

Just how good-looking and nice and suave he is.
